question.query: what sectors have had the most revenue growth over the last 30 days and what are the key protocols and catalysts driving it

steps.text:
Short answer first: Over the past 30 days, revenue growth has been strongest in onchain derivatives (perp DEXs), Solana-centric spot DEX/aggregation, L2 sequencers (rollup “blockspace” revenue), and cross-chain bridging/messaging. The spike was driven by renewed memecoin trading, higher volatility/liquidity, new-token incentives/airdrops, and some governance/product catalysts.

Details, with key protocols and catalysts

1) Onchain derivatives (Perp DEXs)
- Who’s driving it: Hyperliquid, Lighter, dYdX v4, GMX v2, Aevo, Vertex.
- What changed:
  - Volatility and renewed retail flow pushed perp volumes/fees up. Industry-wide, onchain perps growth accelerated into late 2025 and has continued into early 2026, with Hyperliquid and newer rivals like Lighter competing for share.
  - Token and incentive catalysts (e.g., Lighter’s airdrop and launch incentives) concentrated flow.
  - New product pairs (memecoin perps) and higher open interest support fee capture.
- References:
  - Perp DEXs almost tripled volume in 2025 as onchain derivatives matured, with Hyperliquid’s lead and growing competition from Lighter/Aster (Cointelegraph, Dec 31, 2025): https://cointelegraph.com/news/perpetuals-dex-volume-2025-onchain-derivatives-growth
  - Lighter token airdrop/launch (DL News, Dec 31, 2025): https://www.dlnews.com/articles/defi/lighter-airdrop-pushes-value-of-hyperliquid-rival-past-2bn/
  - Messari newsflow shows renewed interest in memecoin-focused perp venues in early 2026 (Newsfeed): https://messari.io/news

2) Solana spot DEX and aggregation
- Who’s driving it: Jupiter (aggregator), Raydium, Orca, Phoenix; plus Base/other chains’ DEXs picking up.
- What changed:
  - Memecoin rotation and long-tail trading revived swap volumes and aggregator routing, lifting fee take.
  - CeFi-to-DeFi integration (e.g., Coinbase surfacing Solana DEX liquidity) improves access funnels.
  - Some protocols added routing/MEV protection features that don’t cut fee capture.
- References:
  - Coinbase plugged Solana DEX trading rails (Cointelegraph, Dec 11, 2025): https://cointelegraph.com/news/coinbase-joins-the-cex-dex-convergence-with-solana-integration
  - Token Terminal has project-level 30D fee/revenue views (e.g., Jupiter): https://tokenterminal.com/explorer/projects/jupiter

3) L2 sequencer/blockspace revenue (rollups)
- Who’s driving it: Base, Blast, Arbitrum, Optimism, Scroll, Linea.
- What changed:
  - Onchain activity (social, memecoins, games, perps on L2) lifted gas usage and sequencer margins.
  - Chain-level incentive seasons and app launches concentrated flow on a few rollups, boosting 30D fee sums.
  - Even as Ethereum L1 fees compressed into late 2025, usage shifted to L2s where sequencers capture revenue.
- References:
  - Token Terminal market overview shows 30D sums across sectors/projects: https://tokenterminal.com/explorer
  - Context: Late-2025 data showed L1 fees softening while activity stayed high, implying L2s taking the slack (Cointelegraph, Dec 29, 2025): https://cointelegraph.com/news/higher-activity-lower-fees-december-onchain-data

4) Cross-chain bridges and messaging
- Who’s driving it: Across, Stargate (LayerZero’s Stargate), Wormhole routers, Synapse.
- What changed:
  - Rotations into new L2s and app-chains spiked bridging volumes and fee capture.
  - Airdrop and points campaigns (and fresh token launches) pushed transactional flow across chains.
- References:
  - Project-level fees on TT (e.g., Stargate, Synapse): https://tokenterminal.com/explorer/projects/layerzero/stargate/metrics/fees and https://tokenterminal.com/explorer/projects/synapse/metrics/fees

5) MEV/validator-side capture on Solana and high-throughput chains
- Who’s driving it: Jito (Solana MEV auctions) and validators capturing priority fees during peak memecoin/DEX activity.
- What changed:
  - Bursts of retail flow and priority bidding lift MEV auction revenues and validator fee income, which flow through to protocol-level revenue metrics depending on the tracker’s methodology.
- Note: Some dashboards classify this under “chain revenue” rather than a DeFi “sector.”

6) Uniswap-specific catalyst inside spot DEX sector
- Who: Uniswap (Ethereum + L2s).
- What changed:
  - UNI governance activated the protocol fee switch in late Dec 2025, redirecting a portion of pool fees to protocol revenue/buybacks. That structurally increases “protocol revenue” (vs. pure trading fees paid) in 30D views rolling into January.
- Reference:
  - DL News on the Uniswap fee switch activation: https://www.dlnews.com/articles/defi/uniswap-dao-to-activate-fee-switch-and-burn-100m-uni-tokens/

How I’m defining “revenue” and what to use to verify numbers
- Token Terminal’s market overview and sectors pages show 30-day sums and change vs prior periods for “fees” and “protocol revenue” by project and by sector: https://tokenterminal.com/explorer
- DeFiLlama’s Fees/Revenue dashboards also capture 30D fees and revenue, but are more protocol-level than sector-aggregated via a single link. You can drill in by category and sort on 30D.
- Important: “Fees” are what users pay; “protocol revenue” is what accrues to the protocol/treasury/token after paying out incentives/LPs. Growth rankings can differ depending on which you want.

Want me to pull exact 30D growth percentages and rank sectors by Token Terminal vs DeFiLlama definitions? If you tell me:
- whether you want “total fees” or “protocol revenue,” and
- your preferred source (Token Terminal or DeFiLlama),
I’ll fetch a ranked list with the top sectors, top protocols in each, and the 30D change vs. prior 30D.

parameters.query: site:tokenterminal.com 30d revenue sector crypto last 30 days
DeFiLlama fees and revenue categories 30d change
Messari sector revenue last 30 days crypto
DefiLlama fees last 30 days Hyperliquid fees 30d
"30d fees" crypto perps DEX Token Terminal
DL Research fees revenue roundup sectors last 30 days
Solana DEX volume January 2026 Jupiter Raydium Orca fees revenue 30d
"30d fees" DefiLlama sectors top gainers 30d fees revenue

standardAgentConfig.instructions:
Role: crypto research assistant

        Tools: 'webSearch'

        Utilize web search capabilities to find accurate, current information about crypto projects, trends, and markets.

        Your objective is to be a user's crypto research assistant. Answer the user's question as best as you can
